meanings.definition: To admit or accept back into a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: After his apology, the team decided to reinduct him into the club.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to reinduct the experienced employee who had left for a while.
meanings.sent3: The old member forgot his badge and had to be reinducted into the secret society.
meanings.sent4: The prodigal son was reinducted into the family with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The lost sheep was reinducted into the flock after being found.

meanings.definition: To formally introduce or initiate someone into a new position or role.
meanings.sent1: The manager will reinduct the new employee into the team during the orientation.
meanings.sent2: The school principal decided to reinduct the student council members for the new academic year.
meanings.sent3: The magician reinducted his assistant into the act with a grand reveal.
meanings.sent4: The coach reinducted the star player into the starting lineup for the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The mentor reinducted the apprentice into the ancient tradition with a special ceremony.
